Resolved Question Show me another » Are you supposed to tip at Sonic? I have always wondered if you are supposed to tip the ppl that bring your food out, and if so, how much is reasonable? Would love it if ppl that have or currently do work at Sonic respond! Thanks! 6 years ago Report Abuse by KenlKoff Member since: February 24, 2006 Total points: 10,802 (Level 6) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker If you appreciate the service, (bringing your food to your car and not a drive-thru window is a service) you should be willing to tip. You don't HAVE TO tip, but let's face it, tipping may help to recognize and encourage good service. Often, I just round up or wave back the change. Even 10 percent is better tahn a sharp stick in the eye. Source(s): MOO-SAU-UB 6 years ago Report Abuse
2 people rated this as good Asker's Rating: Asker's Comment: sometimes i feel bad if i don't tip, but then again sometimes im so broke, i can't. Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 3 ) Save Add to My Yahoo! Add to Del.icio.us RSS
erinsada… Yes! I work at Sonic, and it is very much preferred that people tip! That really is how we make our money for such a hard job (trust me there's never a moments rest)! So please, if you can afford to, make a carhop's day and give a tip!! Report Abuse hi yes u should tip at sonic.. thats how we make our money ..we only get 2 57 an hr!!!! Report Abuse Taylor Yes you should tip, But i think that they should pay more at least give the minimum wage. Working as a waitress/servant, you never know what there days are like even if its a $1 or $2 just try and give something every dollar counts just like at a restaurant they make there money from tips mostly. 1 person rated this as good by wayfarou... Member since: April 05, 2006 Total points: 57,745 (Level 7) Add Contact Block No, don't tip, but I hear what you are saying. I usually face this dilema at Mexican places that aren't quite restaraunts--you go to a counter to order, they bring your food, and bus your table, but no one seats you, takes your order, or refills your drinks. I used to leave a buck at places like this, but I'm not sure if that is just insulting.
After a while, I noticed that tip jars are bad luck. Any time I use one, my order is messed up. If it seems tipping is appropriate, I'll hand someone the tip. 6 years ago Report Abuse by C0Tinthe...
